DOC.brief_summary: This study test effectiveness dietary intervention mean measure change RQ upon hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp challenge mean measure kinetic response multiple PF marker ( include RQ ) acute mixed meal challenge 6-week dietary intervention . The challenge apply investigate whether kinetic response well measure health wellbeing compare fasting ( baseline ) level . In addition , several measure reflect perceivable benefit like mood , quality life , sleep quality , cognitive physical performance assess first exploratory attempt link ( change ) PF consumer perceivable benefit . Subjects randomly allocate low glycemic load diet 'Western ' diet 6 week . Before intervention several measurement take place . The low glycemic load diet high polyphenols , protein , vegetable , pulse , fibre nut , low glycemic carbohydrate . All dietary factor show improve glycemic control and/or reduce metabolic syndrome risk factor .
DOC.criteria: Signed informed consent Men postmenopausal woman : ≥ 50 ≤ 70 year start study Body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 25.0 ≤ 35.0 kg/m2 Healthy ( determine dependent physician ) : medical condition might affect study measurement , absorption , metabolism distribution ( include diabetes type 1 type 2 , gastrointestinal dysfunction , gastrointestinal surgery inflammatory disease ) assess physical characteristic health lifestyle questionnaire Fasting blood glucose value ≤ 6.9 mmol/litre screen Waist circumference > 94 cm male , > 80 cm female Maximum 2.5 hour moderate vigorous physical activity per week ( last 3 month ) Agreeing inform medically relevant personal testresults physician Willing comply study protocol study Accessible vein arm determine examination screening Reported participation another nutritional biomedical trial three month prestudy examination study Blood donation past three month Reported participation night shift work two week prior prestudy investigation study . Night work define work midnight 6.00 AM ; Consumption > 21 alcoholic unit male , > 14 alcohol unit female typical week ; Reported use nicotine containing product six month precede study study ; Reported dietary habit : medically prescribe diet , slimming diet , vegetarian ; People familiar allergy intolerance provide food product Reported weight loss weight gain ( 10 % ) last six month prior prestudy screen ; Clinically relevant abnormality clinical chemistry screening ( judge study physician ) ; Being employee Unilever collaborating research department Maastricht University Medical Centre ( MUMC+ ) ; Taking medication , may interfere study measurement , judge responsible physician ; Subjects , want inform unexpected medical finding , wish treat physician inform .
